sources.title: The Loved One (1965) From The Man Who Made "Tom Jones"!
sources.description:
Satire on the funeral business, in which a young British poet goes to work at a Hollywood cemetery.

Original title: The Loved One
Alternative titles: Il caro estinto (Italy), O Ente Querido (Brazil), Los seres queridos (Spain), Tod in Hollywood (Germany), Незабвенная (Russia)

Director: Tony Richardson
Writers: Terry Southern, Christopher Isherwood; based on Evelyn Waugh’s novel The Loved One: An Anglo-American Tragedy

Main cast:
Robert Morse – Dennis Barlow
Jonathan Winters – Reverend Wilbur Glenworthy / Harry Glenworthy
Anjanette Comer – Aimee Thanatogenos
Rod Steiger – Mr. Joyboy
John Gielgud – Sir Francis Hinsley
Dana Andrews – General Buck Brinkman
Liberace – Mr. Starker (casket salesman)
Roddy McDowall – D.J. Jr.
Robert Morley – Sir Ambrose Abercrombie
Paul Williams – Gunther Fry (debut role)

Genres: Black comedy, satire
Release date: October 11, 1965 (USA)
Filming locations: Primarily Los Angeles, including Hollywood, Beverly Hills

metadata.Plot: Newly arrived in Hollywood from England, Dennis Barlow finds he has to arrange his uncle's interment at the highly-organised and very profitable Whispering Glades funeral parlour. His fancy is caught by one of their cosmeticians, Aimee Thanatogenos. But he has three problems - the strict rules of owner Blessed Reverand Glenworthy, the rivalry of embalmer Mr Joyboy, and the shame of now working himself at The Happy Hunting Ground pets' memorial home.
metadata.Writer: Evelyn Waugh, Terry Southern, Christopher Isherwood
metadata.Actors: Robert Morse, Jonathan Winters, Anjanette Comer
